result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:35 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Bryant J Swiggum appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Bryant J Swiggum.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard on the status of the case.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on January 26, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:48 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Bryant J Swiggum not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Bryant J Swiggum.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard on the non appearance of client. 
State requests a warrant. 
Court will find another day for JSH.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Jury status hearing on October 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Confidential Crime Victim(s) Information
Notice of Hearing Returned
Safety Plan

11:22 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Bryant J Swiggum appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Bryant J Swiggum.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant requests a breakout room
Court places Atty. Erickson and def in breakout room
recalled at 11:27

Atty Erickson is heard on status of this case - state waiting to see def's progress with rehab before tendering an offer
Court inquires if couple of months is sufficient - DA confirms this is ok
Jury status hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

No contact with  A.N.H. 
**This bond modification will take affect upon Defendants transport to the treatment facility.

1:16 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Bryant J Swiggum appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mickelson for Jeffrey Warren Erickson by video for Bryant J Swiggum.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

Atty Mickelson is heard on bond. 

State is heard on bond no objections adjusting the bond to a signature bond.  State does not have objection to change the no contact provision. 

Defendant is heard.

Court orders a modification in bond to a signature bond.  All conditions remain the same.  This bond modification will take affect upon Defendants transport to the treatment facility tomorrow.
Bail/bond hearing on July 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail

2:38 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Bryant J Swiggum appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Bryant J Swiggum.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard and defendant waives further formal reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury status hearing on July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Atty. Jeffrey Erickson apptd.

10:31 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Jeffrey W. Erickson appeared by video for Bryant Swiggum  

Comments by def.

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.
Defendant states understanding.   

Court places def/counsel in breakout room (10:37am)
recalled 10:41 - same appearances

Atty. Erickson is heard on bond modification -Probation agent in LaCrosse has arranged alternative to revocation which places him in residential treatment facility
Court would need to hear from, or have written verification from probation agent, before modifying bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 1, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Hearing on May 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:01 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Bryant J. Swiggum appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Court finds probable cause.
     D.A. requests $500 cash bond and prohibit contact with A.N.H. or her residence; same conditions as his La Crosse bond.
     Def. states on a probation hold right now; says his probation agent will remove the no contact condition if he completes treatment; is unemployed right now; requests a signature bond.
     Court comments; orders bond of $500 cash, no contact with A.N.H.  Court advises of right to an atty.
     Court concludes at 1:08 p.m.
Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No contact with A.N.H.
